mention.text: a brain disorder similar to BSE
a microbiology professor at Leeds University and the leading critic of government policy on BSE
the deaths this year of two farmers whose herds had suffered from mad cow disease could not be put down to chance
two farmers whose herds had suffered from mad cow disease
Robert Will of Edinburgh 's Western General Hospital , who has been monitoring CJD in the UK since 1990 on behalf of the health department
The second annual report of Will 's National CJD Surveillance Unit in Edinburgh , published last month
a related brain disease of sheep
Scientists trying to understand the epidemic face an unusual problem : BSE , scrapie and CJD
an abnormal form of a protein that is normally present in the brain -LRB- though its normal function is not yet known -RRB-
